intro: Pavetta salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaf pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, willow-like leaves that are opposite and elliptical in shape. It produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, typically in shades of white or pink. Pavetta salicifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
